tier.item: (1) a. Kolega muDat je otisao iz kue prije njega.
The dative of possession is a means of expressing the attributive possession (Cro pas Ivanu `Ivan's
dog'). The first component of the NP need not be nominative.
The Slavic and East European Language Resource Center
Glossos is the registered trademark of Duke University. All rights reserved.
L. Sari, On the semantics of the "dative of possession" in the Slavic languages
`His colleague had left the house before he did. '

tier.item: b. Prisao sam prozoru. I uplasio se mjesecine sto mi Dat
`I went to the window and became frightened because of the moonshine,
b. Prisao sam prozoru. I uplasio se mjesecine sto mi Dat je udarila u lice.
`I went to the window and became frightened because of the moonshine,
Prisao sam prozoru. I uplasio se mjesecine sto mi Dat je udarila u lice.
I went to the window and became frightened because of the moonshine, that hit into my face.
(3) [...] polozila emuDat na tarelku kusok mjasa v krasnovato-
`She put a piece of meat in the red-golden-brown jelly on his plate.'
(3) [...] polozila emuDat na tarelku kusok mjasa v krasnovato-
`She put a piece of meat in the red-golden-brown jelly on his plate.'
(3) [...] polozila emuDat na tarelku kusok mjasa v krasnovato-
She put a piece of meat in the red-golden-brown jelly on his plate.
(4) On ser'ezno posmotrel mne Dat v lico... (Granin)
On ser'ezno posmotrel mne Dat v lico...
He looked seriously in my face.
(5) a. Postojal, potom naklonilsja i poceloval ej Dat
`He stood there for a certain time, bent forward and kissed her hand.'
(5) a. Postojal, potom naklonilsja i poceloval ej Dat ruku. (Ganina)
`He stood there for a certain time, bent forward and kissed her hand.'
a. Postojal, potom naklonilsja i poceloval ej Dat ruku.
He stood there for a certain time, bent forward and kissed her hand.
b. Larisa Vasil'evna... blagodarno pozala ej ruku. (Lidin)
b. Larisa Vasil'evna... blagodarno pozala ej Dat ruku. (Lidin)
Larisa Vasil'evna... blagodarno pozala ej Dat ruku.
Larisa Vasilevna... gratefully pressed her hand.

tier.item: (6) Slusam i trudim se da budem pribrana, a noge mi Dat
`I am listening and trying to be concentrated, but my legs are suddenly
weak and trembling, they hardly hold me.'

`I am listening and trying to be concentrated, but my legs are suddenly
weak and trembling, they hardly hold me.'

`Earlier the Komitadji killed my father too.'

`Earlier the Komitadji killed my father too.'

Thou condor, brother of the sun
b. Umrl je Bercetov France, druziniDat skrben oce.

d. Bodi mi Dat prijatelj. (Bajec et al. 1956: 137).

b. Ogenj pritajen v oceh jim Dat
`The hidden flame glows in their eyes.'
b. Ogenj pritajen v oceh jim Dat gori (v njihovih oceh).
`The hidden flame glows in their eyes.'
b. Ogenj pritajen v oceh jim Dat gori (v njihovih oceh).
The hidden flame glows in their eyes.
v valove bodre (v tvoje bodre valove). (Bajec et al. 1956:
`I watch your sprightly waves with pleasure.'
c. Rad gledam ti Dat v valove bodre (v tvoje bodre valove). (Bajec et al. 1956:
`I watch your sprightly waves with pleasure.'
c. Rad gledam ti Dat v valove bodre (v tvoje bodre valove). (Bajec et al. 1956:
I watch your sprightly waves with pleasure.
(11) Kaj je nasa tretja luc? Kaj nam je cetrta luc?
`What is our third light? What is the fourth light for us?'
(11) Kaj je nasa tretja luc? Kaj nam Dat je cetrta luc?
`What is our third light? What is the fourth light for us?'
Kaj je nasa tretja luc? Kaj nam Dat je cetrta luc?
What is our third light? What is the fourth light for us?
(12) a. Njegovo knjigo sem nasel, svoje pa ne.
`I have found his book, but not mine.'
(12) a. Njegovo knjigo sem nasel, svoje pa ne.
`I have found his book, but not mine.'
a. Njegovo knjigo sem nasel, svoje pa ne.
I have found his book, but not mine.
b. Oci so se muDat razsirile, usta so se muDat odprla
`His eyes grew wide, he opened his mouth.'
b. Oci so se muDat razsirile, usta so se muDat odprla
`His eyes grew wide, he opened his mouth.'
b. Oci so se muDat razsirile, usta so se muDat odprla

tier.item: dom, ti sreca moja prava. [...] tiha zalost pa je v dusi
razlita - ne rabim te... A zalost ne gre mi Dat
`Where are you, my/the quiet home, you [are] my true joy. [...] the still
hidden sadness is in the soul ­ I do not need you... And my/the sadness
will not go away from me.' (Toporisic 1991: 243)
(14) Kje tihi si mi Dat dom, ti sreca moja prava. [...] tiha zalost pa je v dusi
razlita - ne rabim te... A zalost ne gre mi Dat proc skrita!
`Where are you, my/the quiet home, you [are] my true joy. [...] the still
hidden sadness is in the soul ­ I do not need you... And my/the sadness
will not go away from me.' (Toporisic 1991: 243)
(14) Kje tihi si mi Dat dom, ti sreca moja prava. [...] tiha zalost pa je v dusi razlita-ne rabim te... A zalost ne gre mi Dat proc skrita!
Where are you, my/the quiet home, you [are] my true joy. [...] the still hidden sadness is in the soul ­ I do not need you... And my/the sadness will not go away from me.
(15) a. Sen muDat ne stisne oci.
`The sleep did not close his eyes.'
(15) a. Sen muDat ne stisne oci.
`The sleep did not close his eyes.'
(15) a. Sen muDat ne stisne oci.
The sleep did not close his eyes.
b. So crni lasje mi in crne oci.
b. So crni lasje mi Dat in crne oci.
b. So crni lasje mi Dat in crne oci.
My hair and eyes are dark.
c. Sonce zarko se zbudi, viruDat vale posusi.
`The burning sun woke up and dried the waves of the spring.'
c. Sonce zarko se zbudi, viruDat vale posusi.
`The burning sun woke up and dried the waves of the spring.'
c. Sonce zarko se zbudi, viruDat vale posusi.
The burning sun woke up and dried the waves of the spring.
b. Zajrzala mi Dat do gardla/do kieszeni.
Zajrzala mi Dat do gardla/do kieszeni.
She looked into my throat/my pocket.

d. Adam wkradl si Ewie Dat do sypialni.

The dog has licked my hand.

`When he returned, he saw that his house had burned down.'
